bibl.title: Letter from Frederick L. Rath, Jr., to Maria Teresa Rojas, April 4, 1952

div1.p: Rath suggests a schedule for his visit to the Finca San Jose, and hopes to offer Rojas advice on preservation of the property.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick L. Rath, Jr., to Maria Teresa Rojas, April 4, 1952
div1.opener:
April 4, 1952
Senora Maria Teresa Rojas
Finca San Jose
Calzada Real y Gomez Redencion
Quemados de Marianao
Havana, Cuba
My dear Senora Rojas:
div1.p:
Dr. Hench, as you know, has transmitted to me your most
gracious invitation to visit you at the Finca San Jose. I am deeply
grateful and shall be delighted to accept if the time is convenient
for you.

On April 25 I must be in Jacksonville, Florida, in order
to address the annual meeting of the Florida Historical Society.
During the next several days I shall be quite busy in the vicinity
of Jacksonville and St. Augustine. It will be possible, however, for
me to fly to Havana from Miami on the morning of April 29. I do not
wish to impose unduly on you, but, if you wish, I shall be willing
to stay until the morning of May 1. Then I think I must return
quickly to my office in Washington for a meeting on May 2.

If these arrangements are satisfactory to you, please let
me know so that I may make the necessary airline reservations. I
look forward with great pleasure to meeting you and it is my sincere
hope that I shall be able, on the basis of our experiences in the
National Council and Trust, to offer some worthwhile suggestions in
regard to your problem.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours Frederick L. Rath, Jr.
Director FLR:M
cc: Dr. Philip S. Hench
